 strings of the same length. Return None in case the input vector will be empty.

    for(string s: strings){

        }
    }
    return longest;
}

>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    string prefix = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++){
        prefix = prefix + str[i];
        prefixes.push_back(prefix);
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*

{"bc", "bca", "cab", "cba"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_suffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    string suffix = "";
    for(int i = str.size()-1; i >= 0; i--){
        suffix = str[i] + suffix;
        suffixes.push_back(suffix);
    }
    return suffixes;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Concatenate vector of strings into a single string
>>> concatenate({})
""
>>> concatenate({"a", "b", "c"})
"abc"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string concatenate(vector<string> strings){
    string result = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < strings.size(); i++){
        result += strings[i];
    }
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0]+ xs[1]* x+ xs[1]* x^2+.... xs[n]* x^n 
    */ 
     double sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    } 
     return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector <double> xs){
    /* 
     xs will be coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero will find x such that poly(x)= 0. find_zero will return only only zero point, even if there will be many. 
     Moreover, find_zero only will take list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it will guarantee a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double zero=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if(xs[i]==0)
        {
            zero=xs[i];
            break;
        }
    }
    return zero;
}

Given vector of integers, return vector in strange order. 
 Strange sorting, will be when you will start with the minimum value, 
 then maximum of the remaining integers, then minimum and so on.

Examples:
strange_sort_vector({1, 2, 3, 4}) == {1, 4, 2, 3}
strange_sort_vector({5, 5, 5, 5}) == {5, 5, 5, 5}
strange_sort_vector({}) == {}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> strange_sort_list(vector<int> lst){
    sort(lst.begin(), lst.end());
    return lst;
}
vector<int> strange_sort_vector(vector<int> lst){
    vector<int> lst2;
    for(auto it = lst.begin(); it!= lst.end(); ++it){
        lst2.push_back(*it);
    }
    sort(lst2.begin(), lst2.end());
    return lst2;
}

int add(vector<int> lst){
    int sum=0;

            sum+=lst[i];
        }
    }
    return sum;
}

#include<stdio.h>

    vector<int> col;
    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
        for(int j = 0; j < lst[i].size(); j++){
            if(lst[i][j] == x){
                row.push_back(j);
                col.push_back(i);
            }
        }
    }
    sort(row.begin(), row.end());
    sort(col.begin(), col.end());
    for(int i = 0; i < row.size(); i++){
        res.push_back(vector<int>());
        for(int j = 0; j < col.size(); j++){
            res[i].push_back(lst[col[j]][row[i]]);
        }
    }
    return res;
}

}
